meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of glycosidic bonds in glucosides.
meanings.sent1: The glucosidases in our bodies help break down certain types of sugars.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how glucosidases work to understand their role in digestion.
meanings.sent3: The glucosidases at the party were breaking down the sugary treats with impressive speed.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like the relentless action of glucosidases breaking down bonds.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration vividly showed how glucosidases break apart sugar molecules.

meanings.definition: Proteins that break down complex carbohydrates into simpler sugars.
meanings.sent1: Glucosidases are important for turning complex carbs into easier-to-digest sugars.
meanings.sent2: The body relies on glucosidases to help process the carbohydrates we eat.
meanings.sent3: The glucosidases in the bakery were working hard to simplify the pastry ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to simplify complex problems was like that of glucosidases breaking down carbohydrates.
meanings.sent5: The chef's explanation made it clear how glucosidases break down carbohydrates into sugars.

meanings.definition: Biological catalysts that aid in the digestion of starches and sugars.
meanings.sent1: Glucosidases play a key role in helping our bodies digest starches and sugars.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how glucosidases function to improve digestive health.
meanings.sent3: The glucosidases in the digestive system were having a party breaking down food.
meanings.sent4: Her support was like that of glucosidases aiding in the digestion process.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustration vividly showed how glucosidases assist in breaking down starches.
